body:
Chivalry is a joke and inverts christian teaching. What started as rules of combat was transmogrified into man serving a woman he cannot have, and for some reason christian men took off with it. Its no wonder we have the intersexual issues we have in modern times when christian men hold to an ideal that idolizes women and makes them the end all and be all of existence.

Christianity: Woman is under the authority of her father first and then her husband. She serves her husband and is both obedient and submissive.
Chivalry: Man is under the authority of a "lady" and will debase himself for her honor.

If anything the modern concept of chivalry mocks christianity (https://dalrock.wordpress.com/2019/05/21/academics-understand-that-chivalry-isnt-christian/).

body:
Yes, but that's far different from the teaching of chivalry. A man should love his wife as Christ loved the church, which includes provision and protection, even to the point of giving up his life. Chivalry teaches that a man should debase himself for women altogether, but especially for the lady whom he serves, often times not one he is married to or can even expect to receive love from, simply "favor".

>The sentiment, of course, is love, but love of a highly specialized sort, whose characteristics may be enumerated as Humility, Courtesy, Adultery, and the Religion of Love. The lover is always abject. Obedience to his lady’s lightest wish, however whimsical, and silent acquiescence in her rebukes, however unjust, are the only virtues he dares to claim.

~C.S. Lewis, The Allegory of Love

Not only that, but Lewis describes how, compared to biblical marriage, the idea of chivalry is adulterous in nature, give the fact that the bible assigns a woman to be under the authority of her husband:

>The love which is to be the source of all that is beautiful in life and manners must be the reward freely given by the lady, and only our superiors can reward. But a wife is not a superior.81 As the wife of another, above all as the wife of a great lord, she may be queen of beauty and of love, the distributor of favours, the inspiration of all knightly virtues, and the bridle of ‘villany’;82 but as your own wife, for whom you have bargained with her father, she sinks at once from lady into mere woman. How can a woman, whose duty is to obey you, be the midons whose grace is the goal of all striving and whose displeasure is the restraining influence upon all uncourtly vices?

The concept of chivalry is the anti-marriage, yet christians continue to grasp hold of it for dear life while sneering at the actual, biblical instruction for marriage in the word because it places husbands as the defacto authority over their wives in every thing. Husbands are given full authority and control over their wives yet that authority is to be filtered through the love of Christ, as prescribed by the verse you posted. Instead modern feminism, chivalry and weak christianity have made the very idea of husbands having that kind of authority over their wives anathema. Now women are angered by the prospect while men cower in fear over it.

(https://dalrock.wordpress.com/2016/12/14/courtly-love-the-origins-of-cuckchivalry/)

body:
Defending ""being a gentleman"" has always disgusted me. You don't owe women anything, and especially not on account of their gender. You have no duty to put them on a pedestal. I was pleased to find that the kids nowadays abhor such behaviour to the point of making up the term "simp" (the word already existed but not under that meaning) to insult such people. I was worried clicking on this, but it was good to see @SnapperTrx's reply.

p.s.: whoever downvoted me and didn't bother to reply is a massive faggot

I was pleased to find that the kids nowadays abhor such behaviour to the point of making up the term "simp" (the word already existed but not under that meaning) to insult such people. body:
Well knightly chivalry isn’t to a wife. It was to a noble he needed to protect. That’s not exactly something the peasants were doing. A typical man treating a typical lady with respect had the opportunity to court her and likely succeeded. 

Unrequited infatuation is unhealthy and unproductive. 

In general I think the culture of honor was good. Victorian era type elegance. Women could be feminine and dainty because societally men protected them. 

Now in Sweden and Britain girls want to become boys because they’re scared of being raped by immigrants. Society does not protect them. 

As far as biblical marriage. I dislike that hearing that talk in that manner myself. In certain lights it grants a hard edged entitlement. Jesus sacrificed His life for the church. He draws people to Himself, but He doesn’t force anyone to do anything. The fruits of Godly character are self control, patience, kindness, gentleness etc and a husband should have those in his conduct toward his wife. A wife is not something to control. The husband and wife are supposed to have a feedback loop of love and respect where the man initiates. If the man’s call is to love like Jesus, then wife should easily submit to that love—that’s not a hard thing.
body_html:

Unrequited infatuation is unhealthy and unproductive.

In general I think the culture of honor was good. Victorian era type elegance. Women could be feminine and dainty because societally men protected them.

Now in Sweden and Britain girls want to become boys because they’re scared of being raped by immigrants. Society does not protect them.

As far as biblical marriage. I dislike that hearing that talk in that manner myself. In certain lights it grants a hard edged entitlement. Jesus sacrificed His life for the church. He draws people to Himself, but He doesn’t force anyone to do anything. The fruits of Godly character are self control, patience, kindness, gentleness etc and a husband should have those in his conduct toward his wife. A wife is not something to control. The husband and wife are supposed to have a feedback loop of love and respect where the man initiates. If the man’s call is to love like Jesus, then wife should easily submit to that love—that’s not a hard thing.

author.bio: Just a guy on the internet who's avatar is a giant mutant crocodile. In my spare time I make wooden things, 3D artwork and work on my tabletop RPG, Destructive Tendencies.
author.bio_html: Just a guy on the internet who's avatar is a giant mutant crocodile. In my spare time I make wooden things, 3D artwork and work on my tabletop RPG, Destructive Tendencies.

body:
Indeed I think respect and honor toward all people, unless they have proven the effort to be a waste of time, is a good thing.

As for biblical marriage, the fact that it leaves one in dislike does not change the fact. God did not create marriage as an egalitarian effort and there is no required "feedback loop of love and respect", though the presence of one is a good thing. God commands the wives of unbelievers to STILL submit in obedience toward their unbelieving husbands, and commands christian husbands to continue to care and provide for their unbelieving wives. The love of a husband and the submission of a wife is not dependent upon the "feedback" of their spouse but on the obedience and submission towards God. In this neither the husband nor wife has any excuse they can place on the other, but must take the mantle of obedience on themselves.

I don't say this with any malice, but modern christians place too much emphasis on the importance of romantic love in marriage when the bible calls for no such thing. It doesn't discount romantic love, but romance is not a requirement of marriage nor a requirement of loyalty, obedience, submission, provision or protection. Solomon had hundreds of wives and it is doubtful he was romantically involved with more than a handful of them. He loved them by providing for them, though it was likely he didn't remember most of their names and likely had little interaction with them beyond sex, yet romance is made to justify modern marriage rather than the other way around. If a woman doesn't feel like she is romantically loved enough many modern christians give her cart blanche to end the marriage.

Also many modern christians make the mistake, mostly because they are told falsehoods and are raised in a very feminized society, that women will just naturally submit to a man who exhibits christ-like virtues, but nothing could be further from the truth. Women are rebellious by nature which is one of the many reasons God put her under the authority if her father first and then her husband. Of course, this line of thinking is extremely offensive even to modern christians or conservatives. The mere concept that women need to be under an authority is enough to send a congregation into foaming-at-the-mouth fits, yet this is what the bible teaches, whether we dislike hearing it or not.
body_html:

As for biblical marriage, the fact that it leaves one in dislike does not change the fact. God did not create marriage as an egalitarian effort and there is no required "feedback loop of love and respect", though the presence of one is a good thing. The love of a husband and the submission of a wife is not dependent upon the "feedback" of their spouse but on the obedience and submission towards God. In this neither the husband nor wife has any excuse they can place on the other, but must take the mantle of obedience on themselves.

I don't say this with any malice, but modern christians place too much emphasis on the importance of romantic love in marriage when the bible calls for no such thing. It doesn't discount romantic love, but romance is not a requirement of marriage nor a requirement of loyalty, obedience, submission, provision or protection. Solomon had hundreds of wives and it is doubtful he was romantically involved with more than a handful of them. He loved them by providing for them, though it was likely he didn't remember most of their names and likely had little interaction with them beyond sex, yet romance is made to justify modern marriage rather than the other way around. If a woman doesn't feel like she is romantically loved enough many modern christians give her cart blanche to end the marriage.

Also many modern christians make the mistake, mostly because they are told falsehoods and are raised in a very feminized society, that women will just naturally submit to a man who exhibits christ-like virtues, but nothing could be further from the truth. Women are rebellious by nature which is one of the many reasons God put her under the authority if her father first and then her husband. Of course, this line of thinking is extremely offensive even to modern christians or conservatives. The mere concept that women need to be under an authority is enough to send a congregation into foaming-at-the-mouth fits, yet this is what the bible teaches, whether we dislike hearing it or not.

body: When I wore a young man's clothes and the shiny new armor of ignorance, I respected women and believed them and so I wanted to protect all women from mean men. Now that I am much older and more wise to the ways of women, I have changed. Now, if I see a man beating up on a women, my first thought is, "What did that bitch do to deserve such an unchivalrous treatment?"

Now that I am much older and more wise to the ways of women, I have changed. Now, if I see a man beating up on a women, my first thought is, "What did that bitch do to deserve such an unchivalrous treatment?"

body:
Funny how a century ago some women took great pride in their husbands being violent toward them. Not saying I approve, but some of the stories I have read of women begging their husbands to take hold of them and bruise them, then crying when they instead apologize for a perceived slight, is like being in the twilight zone. I didn't catch who was singing this morning but while listening to the 40s channel on my Sirius XM the woman was singing about how her man hit her and she liked it and anyone who thought differently had no right to say anything. Some of the stories I have read indicated that the anger and passion required for a man to strike his woman was a sign that he loved her while his being a wet noodle meant there was no spark of passion!

Sometimes truth is stranger than fiction.
body_html:
Funny how a century ago some women took great pride in their husbands being violent toward them. Not saying I approve, but some of the stories I have read of women begging their husbands to take hold of them and bruise them, then crying when they instead apologize for a perceived slight, is like being in the twilight zone. I didn't catch who was singing this morning but while listening to the 40s channel on my Sirius XM the woman was singing about how her man hit her and she liked it and anyone who thought differently had no right to say anything. Some of the stories I have read indicated that the anger and passion required for a man to strike his woman was a sign that he loved her while his being a wet noodle meant there was no spark of passion!

Sometimes truth is stranger than fiction.

parent.body: When I wore a young man's clothes and the shiny new armor of ignorance, I respected women and believed them and so I wanted to protect all women from mean men. Now that I am much older and more wise to the ways of women, I have changed. Now, if I see a man beating up on a women, my first thought is, "What did that bitch do to deserve such an unchivalrous treatment?"

body:
> Also many modern christians make the mistake, mostly because they are told falsehoods and are raised in a very feminized society, that women will just naturally submit to a man who exhibits christ-like virtues, but nothing could be further from the truth. Women are rebellious by nature which is one of the many reasons God put her under the authority if her father first and then her husband. Of course, this line of thinking is extremely offensive even to modern christians or conservatives. The mere concept that women need to be under an authority is enough to send a congregation into foaming-at-the-mouth fits, yet this is what the bible teaches, whether we dislike hearing it or not.

You are basing this whole line of thinking on a one-liner from 1 Timothy, one of the most heretical books in the bible, which was composed as part of a slapfight between the catholic fathers and Marcionites and attributed to Paul to counter Marcion (because Paul was his favorite apostle). Somehow women became associated with Marcionism and gnosticism at some point in the second century, with Marcion possibly having been a woman named Marcellina, so the church decided that women are inherently more evil than men just to ruffle Marcion's feathes. It seems the early church was more concerned with winning against Marcion than defending the truth, and unfortunately they've had us fooled for thousands of years longer than they even intended. You would be absolutely appalled and disgusted if you heard of Deborah, Ruth, Mary Magdalene, or countless others. And you wouldn't like the gospels either, Jesus supports eunuchs and says we will be like the angels in the resurrection, almost certainly implying genderlessness.
body_html:
Also many modern christians make the mistake, mostly because they are told falsehoods and are raised in a very feminized society, that women will just naturally submit to a man who exhibits christ-like virtues, but nothing could be further from the truth. Women are rebellious by nature which is one of the many reasons God put her under the authority if her father first and then her husband. Of course, this line of thinking is extremely offensive even to modern christians or conservatives. The mere concept that women need to be under an authority is enough to send a congregation into foaming-at-the-mouth fits, yet this is what the bible teaches, whether we dislike hearing it or not.

You are basing this whole line of thinking on a one-liner from 1 Timothy, one of the most heretical books in the bible, which was composed as part of a slapfight between the catholic fathers and Marcionites and attributed to Paul to counter Marcion (because Paul was his favorite apostle). Somehow women became associated with Marcionism and gnosticism at some point in the second century, with Marcion possibly having been a woman named Marcellina, so the church decided that women are inherently more evil than men just to ruffle Marcion's feathes. It seems the early church was more concerned with winning against Marcion than defending the truth, and unfortunately they've had us fooled for thousands of years longer than they even intended. You would be absolutely appalled and disgusted if you heard of Deborah, Ruth, Mary Magdalene, or countless others. And you wouldn't like the gospels either, Jesus supports eunuchs and says we will be like the angels in the resurrection, almost certainly implying genderlessness.

parent.body:
Indeed I think respect and honor toward all people, unless they have proven the effort to be a waste of time, is a good thing.

As for biblical marriage, the fact that it leaves one in dislike does not change the fact. God did not create marriage as an egalitarian effort and there is no required "feedback loop of love and respect", though the presence of one is a good thing. God commands the wives of unbelievers to STILL submit in obedience toward their unbelieving husbands, and commands christian husbands to continue to care and provide for their unbelieving wives. The love of a husband and the submission of a wife is not dependent upon the "feedback" of their spouse but on the obedience and submission towards God. In this neither the husband nor wife has any excuse they can place on the other, but must take the mantle of obedience on themselves.

I don't say this with any malice, but modern christians place too much emphasis on the importance of romantic love in marriage when the bible calls for no such thing. It doesn't discount romantic love, but romance is not a requirement of marriage nor a requirement of loyalty, obedience, submission, provision or protection. Solomon had hundreds of wives and it is doubtful he was romantically involved with more than a handful of them. He loved them by providing for them, though it was likely he didn't remember most of their names and likely had little interaction with them beyond sex, yet romance is made to justify modern marriage rather than the other way around. If a woman doesn't feel like she is romantically loved enough many modern christians give her cart blanche to end the marriage.

Also many modern christians make the mistake, mostly because they are told falsehoods and are raised in a very feminized society, that women will just naturally submit to a man who exhibits christ-like virtues, but nothing could be further from the truth. Women are rebellious by nature which is one of the many reasons God put her under the authority if her father first and then her husband. Of course, this line of thinking is extremely offensive even to modern christians or conservatives. The mere concept that women need to be under an authority is enough to send a congregation into foaming-at-the-mouth fits, yet this is what the bible teaches, whether we dislike hearing it or not.

The love of a husband and the submission of a wife is not dependent upon the "feedback" of their spouse but on the obedience and submission towards God. In this neither the husband nor wife has any excuse they can place on the other, but must take the mantle of obedience on themselves.

I don't say this with any malice, but modern christians place too much emphasis on the importance of romantic love in marriage when the bible calls for no such thing. Of course, this line of thinking is extremely offensive even to modern christians or conservatives.
